page.title: 18LANDSCAPE OF GODMERSHAM
page.content: The landscape of Godmersham is dominated by the hills and woods of the North Downs and the River Stour flowing in a long valley running SW to NE. It is a chalk stream for most of its length, important for drainage, conservation, angling and water-usage. The village lies in a small part of the valley with a railway and road running through it. On the N side Kings Wood and Challock Forest predominate with the North Downs Way running through them The hill behind the church shows pre-medieval systems of agriculture. On the S side are smaller parcels of woodland, Purrs Wood and Chilham Downs and on the N boundary the old road to Chilham, with some old cottages known as Mountain Street. To the E is an early British burial mound possibly of a Roman general.
